intro: Amsinckia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, gray-green leaves and its clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a distinctive feature of its native habitat.
